column4: How do I know which version of amarok will be installed if I do sudo apt-get install amarok ? I'd like to install amarok2 if possible in ubuntu 8.10
aptitude show amarok
http://www.kubuntu.org/news/amarok-2.0
Thanks. aptitude show amarok gives: version 2:1.4.10-0ubuntu3, but isn't that the version number of the package?
the version # of the package is the version that will be installed
But amarok just released 2.0. I doubt very much that they are up to version 2.1.something already
um, it's version 1.4.10...
Oh. Then I don't want that package... Any idea if it's possible to install version 2.0 somehow?
yes, scroll up and see the two links we gave you
That link talks about installing on kubuntu. I don't see that it applies to ubuntu in that it talks about adept updater and stuff like that
er, as long as you add the right repositories, it'll install on ubuntu
the only difference is you'll have to pull in some qt packages that ubuntu doesn't come with
Yes, but I still don't understand how I tell apt, aptitude or whatever to install 2.0 instead of 1.4 after having added that line to the repository
the package name should be amarok-kde4, i believe
OK. I'll try that
tell me how it is for you, btw. i didn't like it much, though i didn't give it much of a real chance
It's installing now. I hopw it's the right version. :) How on earth did you know that the package name is amarok-kde4?
someone was asking about it yesterday
also, "aptitude search amarok" would have told you
Ahh. Very nice. Thank you very much for the help. Much appreciated here. :)
np
